totem.sound
Class TPlayer

java.lang.Object
  totem.sound.TPlayer

public class TPlayer
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper for processing player and beat detection functionality. It can send audio signals to the output and receive them through the microphone. The output signal will be analyzed by the beat detection.

Author:
alex

Constructor Detail

TPlayer

public TPlayer(processing.core.PApplet parent,
               java.lang.String file)
Initialize the TPlayer object. the parent object is needed to initialize the sound framework minim. Later the minim object is held directly and the parent reference is not used anylonger. The file given will be played if the player is activated.

Parameters:
file - mp3 file to be player
Method Detail

loop

public void loop()
Starts playing the actual song in a loop.

setGain

public void setGain(float gain)
Set the volume of the output.

Parameters:
gain - the new gain volume

getInLevel

public float getInLevel()
Returns the actual input noise level.

Returns:
actual microphone noise level

beatDetected

public boolean beatDetected()
Returns if a beat is detected right now or not. Right now the implementation just includes lower pitch beat detection and has to be called manually.

Returns:

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shut down the TPlayer. This method stops the song and shut down the minim framework. It should be called if the application is terminated to avoid locks of the audio channels.
